programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.sub-title: Ne pas tricher avec la nature
programme.desc: Don't cheat with nature Tanguy Collet decided to change his life and dedicate it to bee-keeping. The nursery growers raising awareness amongst schoolchildren about how climate change will affect the forests. In Cannes, Marina Picasso invites us into the garden of the Villa Californie, redesigned by landscape architect Jean Mus. Don't panic: Thibaud's garden. Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc:
Bivouac life at sub-zero temperatures

It's the last chance for the first group to convince the guides of their skills. One of the roped parties struggles to find a way up while the other tackles a highly technical rock face. After a 10-hour day they must now spend the night outside at -10 degrees.

Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 7, episode 6:

Spotlight on French-style gastronomy and high-end dining thanks to tableware from the Sèvres Manufactory. How to wear a cap backwards and pastel colours. Parisian blazers by Capucine Martin. In Strasbourg, the Au Fond du Jardin tea rooms have made the madeleine its speciality, and offer a surprising range.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
Éric Pras (2/2)
In the company of the Burgundy chef Éric Pras, we discover one of France's most emblematic wine-growing areas. An opportunity to follow a culinary trail that continues in Dijon, in the heart of the International Centre for Gastronomy and Wine, and witness a "battle" between two exceptional young chefs.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life on a smallholding In Alberta, Roger and Virginie live on their smallholding with their three children. The couple like keeping certain traditions alive, such as bringing in the hay, and rope Julien in to lend a hand. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the library of the National Institute for Art History. Encounter with the French photographer Carole Bellaïche. Exploring Paris on the trail of a daring scientist: Marie Curie. Focus on Simon, a craftsman armed with patience and passion, who reveals the skills of a rare profession: luthier. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.desc: The Tuileries gardens Skilfully bending chestnut hoops to bind barrels, a hooper reveals all the secrets of an age-old craft. When chickens and ducks become the organic gardener's best friend, efficiently replacing pesticides. Discovering the Jardin des Tuileries. Don't panic: Denis's garden. Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc:
Endurance test

It's the second group's turn to prove themselves, which begins... at the supermarket. Buying strategically for several days, then carrying everything by backpack isn't simple. The 2,000 metre climb to reach the shelter is the first endurance test.

Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 7, episode 7:

In Vanves, a visit to Pierre Basse's wrought iron workshop. All about the apron. In Lille, Le Colonel is a company specialising in the artisanal manufacture of bow ties, ties and braces. How to wear asymmetric clothing. In Romans-sur-Isère, Un Si Beau Pas makes luxury footwear.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
Sébastien Ripari
Expert in international gastronomy, Sébastien Ripari reveals a little-known Paris, one of narrow cobbled streets, busy everyday markets, culinary institutions and secret addresses. For the "friend of the chefs", the French capital is a celebration, preferably involving glorious food and shared with friends.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life as a nomadic family The Roldan-Forest family have lived, worked and schooled their children in their bus for the last seven years. What made the couple want to offer their children this alternative lifestyle? Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Basilica Cathedral of Saint-Denis in the footsteps of the French kings. Encounter with the designer Ionna Vautrin. Some of the most energising and flavoursome addresses, for caffeine-addicts in search of a really good coffee! Stained glass: from cathedrals to traditional or contemporary homes. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Vachement Normand !
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Chicken pizzas and a honey-miso salmon bowl
Two recipes for easy meals that don't compromise on taste: chicken pizza on butter naan bread and a quick honey-miso marinated salmon bowl.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc: The last resort On the Crozon Peninsula, the Flotille 33F helicopter squadron specialises in rescue missions. At the controls of their giant Caiman helicopters, the handful of pilots are ready to intervene day or night, whatever the weather, or almost. They offer a last hope for sailors in danger, the last resort. Report by: Grégoire Gosset. Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Maisons-Alfort National Veterinary School. Encounter with Amélie Viaene, a multi-facetted jeweller. Along the Seine, three go-to addresses for everything to do with fishing. Cow bells, the sound and know-how of age-old traditions. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Rouleaux de printemps et sauces vietnamiennes
programme.desc: Spring rolls and Vietnamese sauces Ross Louangsignotha offers some invaluable advice for making successful spring rolls with prawns and smoked meat. And for the perfect finishing touch, two easy to make Vietnamese sauces. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Nos maisons
programme.desc: Shoebox At the beginning of the 20th century they enabled workers to leave the more insalubrious districts and buy their own home. Shoebox houses are very characteristic of Montreal. Directed by: Mathieu Baer (Canada, 2019)

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Ramara, Ontario
Behind the walls of a house: an invasion of bees! Louis will do his best to resolve this case.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Rudimentary cuisine Christian gathers everyone together for a rudimentary meal with a recipe from François Papineau, conserves from Bob le Chef and fondu from Réal Bossé. Mathieu Hébert grills the meat and smokes the fish without a stove or a pan. Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: The peony garden Katharina Shepherd spent ten years living in Japan, which was where she developed her passion for peonies. In her magnificent garden with a view of Lake Thun, she grows a range of rare species. Presented by: Katharina Locher.

programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Cité du Vin in Bordeaux. Encounter with the French Michelin-starred chef Guy Savoy in his restaurant at the Monnaie de Paris.
